fields.title: Harris 2004 Public Opinion Survey, study no. 22091

dsDescription.dsDescriptionValue: "Topics addressed in this study include the most important issues for the government to address, ratings of political leaders and parties, favorite candidates for the 2004 presidential election, favor keeping troops in Iraq or bringing most of our troops home in the next year, effect of the invasion of Iraq on the war on terrorism, accuracy of the U.S. government's reports of Iraq's weapons of mass destruction and links to Al Qaeda, influence of issues including the economy and jobs, and Iraq and the war on terror on voting decisions; concerns about expanded surveillance powers to monitor people suspected of terrorist activity, and gun control. Demographic variables include respondent's sex, age, educational status, disability status, origin or descent (Spanish, Hispanic, or Latino), race, self identified political party, political philosophy, number of individuals age 18 or over who live in the household, presence of a disabled individual age 16 or over who lives in the household, household income, and number of voice telephone lines available at home."

fields.notesText: Subject: Study Level Error Note, Notes: National cross-sectional sample of persons 18 years of age or older interviewed by telephone.; Subject: null  Type: ODUM:ACCESS.CATEGORY  Notes: I; Subject: null  Type: ODUM:CODEBOOK.NUMBER  Notes: H-22091;

distributor.distributorName: Odum Institute for Research in Social Science, University of North Carolina
